results.title: Discover Australia's national parks
results.brief_description: Shows what to see and do in Australia’s National Parks, their location and the facilities available for visitors. This film shows Port Campbell, Wyperfeld, Mt. Buffalo and Wilson’s Promontory National Parks - all in Victoria. Narrated by Robert Raymond.
results.description: Shows what to see and do in Australia’s National Parks, their location and the facilities available for visitors. This film shows Port Campbell, Wyperfeld, Mt. Buffalo and Wilson’s Promontory National Parks - all in Victoria. Narrated by Robert Raymond.

results.title: Discover America
results.creator_credit: Reid Ray Films and Reid H Ray
results.brief_description: The United States from the air, mostly filmed from a helicopter. The scenes are varied - the Statue of Liberty, the Grand Canyon, the Rockies, Las Vegas, Disneyland and the volcanic Mount Pelee in Hawaii. Also shows other sites of historical interest. Excellent photography by David Butler. Narrated by Meredith Burgess.

results.title: Disco
results.creator_credit: Film Australia, Tom Manefield and Phil Noyce
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Growing Up”.
This film considers social and sexual expectations and attitudes of teenagers attending a disco. Their perceptions of male and female roles, the similarities and differences are portrayed through their behaviour, conversation and dress. Cinematography by Mike Edols.

results.title: Disciplining. Pt. 2. Reprimanding
results.brief_description: Shows several examples of correct and incorrect reprimanding of employees by supervisors. Shows how the efficiency and production in an office can be increased or decreased depending on how a situation is handled.

results.title: Discipline: Giving orders
results.brief_description: A Navy training film promoting the idea that staff discipline is the function of a co-operative management style. Includes some illuminating footage of model clerical workplaces and an involuntary endorsment of Coca-Cola.

results.title: Discipline during adolescence
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Adolescent Development”.
Discusses the age-old question of how much discipline is good for adolescents. Results of too much and too little parental control are dramatized in a typical family setting.

results.title: Discipline and self control (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: National Audio Visual Center and J Stone
results.brief_description: Discusses the problem of discipline as one of teaching and living with young children. Shows how a teacher can establish control in a friendly climate and prevent disciplinary problems; discusses adequate supervision, the dangers of over and under control and how to help a child accept control. Filmed at various schools in the United States.

results.title: Discipline 2
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “PGR Series”.
PGR Looks at why we discipline our children and the ways we do it, suggesting guidelines for starting the process with young children. Using dramatisations we look at the problem of aggressive behaviour and how to solve it without parents resorting to aggressive behaviour themselves.

results.title: Discipline
results.brief_description: Parents, teachers and psychologists look at this age-old problem. They discuss how to discipline effectively, whether corporal punishment works, problems faced by today’s teachers, negotiating with a child and how discipline can become abuse.
results.description: Parents, teachers and psychologists look at this age-old problem. They discuss how to discipline effectively, whether corporal punishment works, problems faced by today’s teachers, negotiating with a child and how discipline can become abuse.
